def_cn: 单词;字
def_en: A word is a single unit of language that can be represented in writing or speech. In English, a word has a space on either side of it when it is written.

def_cn: 话;话语;所写的文字
def_en: Someone's words are what they say or write.

def_cn: 歌词;唱词
def_en: The words of a song consist of the text that is sung, in contrast to the music that is played.

def_cn: 短时间的谈话;短暂的聊天
def_en: If you have a word with someone, you have a short conversation with them.

def_cn: (警告、建议、赞扬的)话，话语
def_en: If you offer someone a word of something such as warning, advice, or praise, you warn, advise, or praise them.

def_cn: 一句话，一个字(也没有听到、明白或说)
def_en: If you say that someone does not hear, understand, or say a word, you are emphasizing that they hear, understand, or say nothing at all.

def_cn: 消息;信息
def_en: If there is word of something, people receive news or information about it.

def_cn: 誓言;诺言
def_en: If you give your word, you make a sincere promise to someone.

def_cn: 命令;指示
def_en: If someone gives the word to do something, they give an order to do it.

def_cn: 措辞表达;用词表达
def_en: To word something in a particular way means to choose or use particular words to express it.
wording; code word; four-letter word; play on words; printed word; spoken word; written word;

def_cn: 脏字；粗鄙的字眼
def_en: If you say that people consider something to be a dirty word, you mean that they disapprove of it.

def_cn: 收回前言，承认说错了话(尤指此举令说话人显得愚蠢时)
def_en: If you say that someone has to eat their words, you mean that they have to admit that they were wrong about something they said in the past, especially when this makes them look foolish.

def_cn: 沉默寡言的，少言寡语的，话不多的(尤指不谈及自己的意见和感情)
def_en: A person of few words says very little, especially about their opinions or feelings.

def_cn: 从一开始
def_en: If you do something from the word go, you do it from the very beginning of a period of time or situation.

def_cn: (因为仰慕或尊敬而)仔细倾听，一字不落地认真听
def_en: If you hang on someone's every word, you listen very carefully to what they are saying, because you admire or respect them.

def_cn: 从来没一句好话／从来没一句坏话
def_en: You can use expressions such as never have a good word to say or never have a bad word to say to emphasize that a person always criticizes someone or something, or that they never criticize them.

def_cn: (尤指因为一方抱怨了另一方的行为)与…争论,与…严肃讨论
def_en: If one person has words with another, or if two or more people have words, they have a serious discussion or argument, especially because one has complained about the other's behaviour.

def_cn: 用…的话说;引用…的原话说
def_en: You can use in their words or in their own words to indicate that you are reporting what someone said using the exact words that they used.

def_cn: 总而言之;简言之;一句话
def_en: You use in a word to indicate that you are giving a summary of what you have just been saying, or are giving a reply, in as brief a way as possible.

def_cn: (讨论、争论、分歧中的)最终决定权
def_en: If someone has the last word or the final word in a discussion, argument, or disagreement, they are the one who wins it or who makes the final decision.

def_cn: (在奢侈、舒适等方面的)极致
def_en: If you say that something is the last word in luxury, comfort, or some other quality, you are emphasizing that it has a great deal of this quality.

def_cn: (尤指因非常吃惊而)说不出话来，无以言表
def_en: If someone is lost for words, they cannot think of anything to say, especially because they are very surprised by something.

def_cn: 没有直接说;拐弯抹角地说
def_en: If you say that someone has said something, but not in so many words, you mean that they said it or expressed it, but in a very indirect way.

def_cn: (用于强调刚刚警告对方的话很可能成真，尤其是认为对方应改变态度或行为予以避免时)你听着，记住我的话
def_en: If you say 'mark my words' to someone, you are emphasizing that something you have just warned them about is very likely to happen, especially when you think they should change their attitude or behaviour to prevent it.

def_cn: (由)口头
def_en: If news or information passes by word of mouth, people tell it to each other rather than it being printed in written form.

def_cn: 硬说…说过某些话
def_en: If you say that someone is putting words into your mouth or is putting words in your mouth, you mean that they are suggesting that you mean one thing when you really mean something different.

def_cn: 说话算数的人;一诺千金的人
def_en: If you refer to someone as a man of his word or a woman of her word, you mean that they always keep their promises and can be relied on.

def_cn: 换言之;换句话说;也就是说
def_en: You say in other words in order to introduce a different, and usually simpler, explanation or interpretation of something that has just been said.

def_cn: 用…自己的话说
def_en: If you say something in your own words, you express it in your own way, without copying or repeating someone else's description.

def_cn: 传话;递话
def_en: If you pass the word, you tell someone something that another person has told you.

def_cn: 发话，下令(示意某事应该开始)
def_en: If someone says the word, they give their approval as a sign that something should start to happen.

def_cn: 散布消息;传播消息
def_en: If you spread the word, you tell people about something.

def_cn: 对…说的话信以为真
def_en: If you take someone at their word, you believe what they say, when they did not really mean it or when they meant something slightly different.

def_cn: 相信…的话;…说的是真话
def_en: If you say to someone 'take my word for it', you mean that they should believe you because you are telling the truth.

def_cn: 极其愚蠢/荒唐得让人无语
def_en: You can use expressions such as too silly for words and too ridiculous for words to emphasize that someone or something is extremely silly or ridiculous.

def_cn: 信守诺言;说话算话;说到做到
def_en: If you are true to your word or as good as your word, you do what you say you will do.

def_cn: 逐字;一字不差地
def_en: If you repeat something word for word, you repeat it exactly as it was originally said or written.
not get a word in edgeways→see: edgeways;  not mince your words→see: mince;  the operative word→see: operative;  actions speak louder than words→see: speak;  war of words→see: war;
